maml:description.maml:para: Converts a hexadecimal IP address into a dotted decimal string.
ConvertFrom-HexIP takes a hexadecimal string and returns a dotted decimal IP address. An intermediate call is made to ConvertTo-DottedDecimalIP.

maml:Description.maml:para: An IP Address to convert.
An IP Address to convert.

maml:alert.maml:para: Following changes by metablaster: - Include licenses and move comment based help outside of functions
- For code to be consistent with project code formatting and symbol casing.
- Removed unnecessary position arguments, added default argument values explicitly.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the IP address 192.168.0.1.

maml:description.maml:para: Converts a Decimal IP address into a binary format.
ConvertTo-BinaryIP uses System.Convert to switch between decimal and binary format. The output from this function is dotted binary.

maml:Description.maml:para: An IP Address to convert.
An IP Address to convert.

maml:alert.maml:para: Following changes by metablaster: - Include licenses and move comment based help outside of functions
- For code to be consistent with project code formatting and symbol casing.
- Removed unnecessary position arguments, added default argument values explicitly.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Convert an IP address to a binary format.

maml:description.maml:para: Converts a Decimal IP address into a 32-bit unsigned integer.
ConvertTo-DecimalIP takes a decimal IP, uses a shift operation on each octet and returns a single UInt32 value.

maml:Description.maml:para: An IP Address to convert.
An IP Address to convert.

maml:alert.maml:para: Following changes by metablaster: - Include licenses and move comment based help outside of functions
- For code to be consistent with project code formatting and symbol casing.
- Removed unnecessary position arguments, added default argument values explicitly.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Converts an IP address to an unsigned 32-bit integer value.

maml:description.maml:para: Converts either an unsigned 32-bit integer or a dotted binary string to an IP Address.
ConvertTo-DottedDecimalIP uses a regular expression match on the input string to convert to an IP address.

maml:Description.maml:para: A string representation of an IP address from either UInt32 or dotted binary.
A string representation of an IP address from either UInt32 or dotted binary.

maml:alert.maml:para: Following changes by metablaster: - Include licenses and move comment based help outside of functions
- For code to be consistent with project code formatting and symbol casing.
- Removed unnecessary position arguments, added default argument values explicitly.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Convert the binary form back to dotted decimal, resulting in 192.168.0.1.
Convert the decimal form back to dotted decimal, resulting in 192.168.0.1.

maml:description.maml:para: Convert a dotted decimal IP address into a hexadecimal string.
ConvertTo-HexIP takes a dotted decimal IP and returns a single hexadecimal string value.

maml:Description.maml:para: An IP Address to convert.
An IP Address to convert.

maml:alert.maml:para: Following changes by metablaster: - Include licenses and move comment based help outside of functions
- For code to be consistent with project code formatting and symbol casing.
- Removed unnecessary position arguments, added default argument values explicitly.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the hexadecimal string c0a80001.

maml:description.maml:para: Convert a mask length to a dotted-decimal subnet mask.

ConvertTo-Mask returns a subnet mask in dotted decimal format from an integer value ranging between 0 and 32. ConvertTo-Mask creates a binary string from the length, converts the string to an unsigned 32-bit integer then calls ConvertTo-DottedDecimalIP to complete the operation.

maml:Description.maml:para: The number of bits which must be masked.
The number of bits which must be masked.

maml:alert.maml:para: Following changes by metablaster: - Include licenses and move comment based help outside of functions
- For code to be consistent with project code formatting and symbol casing.
- Removed unnecessary position arguments, added default argument values explicitly.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the dotted-decimal form of the mask, 255.255.255.0.

maml:description.maml:para: Convert a dotted-decimal subnet mask to a mask length.
A count of the number of 1's in a binary string.

maml:Description.maml:para: A subnet mask to convert into length.
A subnet mask to convert into length.

maml:alert.maml:para: Following changes by metablaster: - Include licenses and move comment based help outside of functions
- For code to be consistent with project code formatting and symbol casing.
- Removed unnecessary position arguments, added default argument values explicitly.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns 24, the length of the mask in bits.

maml:description.maml:para: Converts IP address formats to a set a known styles.

ConvertTo-Network ensures consistent values are recorded from parameters which must handle differing addressing formats. This Cmdlet allows all other the other functions in this module to offload parameter handling.

maml:Description.maml:para: Either a literal IP address, a network range expressed as CIDR notation, or an IP address and subnet mask in a string.
A subnet mask as an IP address.
Either a literal IP address, a network range expressed as CIDR notation, or an IP address and subnet mask in a string.
A subnet mask as an IP address.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to ConvertTo-Network

maml:description.maml:para: Convert a start and end IP address to the closest matching subnet.
ConvertTo-Subnet attempts to convert a starting and ending IP address from a range to the closest subnet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Any IP address in the subnet.
A subnet mask.
The first IP address from a range.
The last IP address from a range.
Any IP address in the subnet.
A subnet mask.
The first IP address from a range.
The last IP address from a range.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the broadcast address for a network range.
Get-BroadcastAddress returns the broadcast address for a subnet by performing a bitwise AND operation against the decimal forms of the IP address and inverted subnet mask.

maml:Description.maml:para: Either a literal IP address, a network range expressed as CIDR notation, or an IP address and subnet mask in a string.
A subnet mask as an IP address.
Either a literal IP address, a network range expressed as CIDR notation, or an IP address and subnet mask in a string.
A subnet mask as an IP address.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the address 192.168.0.255.
Returns the address 10.0.11.255.
Returns the address 255.255.255.255.
Input values are automatically split into IP address and subnet mask. Returns the address 10.0.0.43.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the network address for a network range.
Get-NetworkAddress returns the network address for a subnet by performing a bitwise AND operation against the decimal forms of the IP address and subnet mask.

maml:Description.maml:para: Either a literal IP address, a network range expressed as CIDR notation, or an IP address and subnet mask in a string.
A subnet mask as an IP address.

A subnet mask as an IP address.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the address 192.168.0.0.
Returns the address 10.0.8.0.
Input values are automatically split into IP address and subnet mask. Returns the address 10.0.23.0.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of IP addresses within the specified network.
Get-NetworkRange finds the network and broadcast address as decimal values then starts a counter between the two, returning IPAddress for each.

maml:Description.maml:para: Either a literal IP address, a network range expressed as CIDR notation, or an IP address and subnet mask in a string.
A subnet mask as an IP address.

The end address of a range.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all IP addresses in the range 192.168.0.0/24.
Returns all IP addresses in the range 192.168.0.0 255.255.252.0.

maml:description.maml:para: Generates a summary describing several properties of a network range
Get-NetworkSummary uses many of the IP conversion commands to provide a summary of a network range from any IP address in the range and a subnet mask.

A subnet mask as an IP address.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of subnets of a given size within a defined supernet.
Generates a list of subnets for a given network range using either the address class or a user-specified value.

maml:Description.maml:para: Any address in the super-net range. Either a literal IP address, a network range expressed as CIDR notation, or an IP address and subnet mask in a string.
The subnet mask of the network to split. Mandatory if the subnet mask is not included in the IPAddress parameter.
Split the existing network described by the IPAddress and subnet mask using this mask.
Any address in the super-net range. Either a literal IP address, a network range expressed as CIDR notation, or an IP address and subnet mask in a string.
The subnet mask of the network to split. Mandatory if the subnet mask is not included in the IPAddress parameter.
Split the existing network described by the IPAddress and subnet mask using this mask.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Four /26 networks are returned.
64 /24 networks are returned.

maml:description.maml:para: Resolves an IP address expression using wildcard expressions to individual IP addresses.

Resolves an IP address expression using wildcard expressions to individual IP addresses. Resolve-IPAddress expands groups and values in square brackets to generate a list of IP addresses or networks using CIDR-notation. Ranges of values may be specified using a start and end value using "-" to separate the values. Specific values may be listed as a comma separated list.

maml:Description.maml:para: The IPAddress expression to resolve.
The IPAddress expression to resolve.

maml:alert.maml:para: Following changes by metablaster: - Include licenses and move comment based help outside of functions
- For code to be consistent with project code formatting and symbol casing.
- Removed unnecessary position arguments, added default argument values explicitly.

maml:description.maml:para: Tests an IP address to determine if it falls within IP address range.

Test-SubnetMember attempts to determine whether or not an address or range falls within another range. The network and broadcast address are calculated the converted to decimal then compared to the decimal form of the submitted address.

maml:Description.maml:para: A representation of the subject, the network to be tested. Either a literal IP address, a network range expressed as CIDR notation, or an IP address and subnet mask in a string.
A representation of the object, the network to test against. Either a literal IP address, a network range expressed as CIDR notation, or an IP address and subnet mask in a string.
A subnet mask as an IP address.
A subnet mask as an IP address.
A representation of the subject, the network to be tested. Either a literal IP address, a network range expressed as CIDR notation, or an IP address and subnet mask in a string.
A representation of the object, the network to test against. Either a literal IP address, a network range expressed as CIDR notation, or an IP address and subnet mask in a string.
A subnet mask as an IP address.
A subnet mask as an IP address.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns true as the subject network can be contained within the object network.
Returns false as the subject network is larger the object network.
Returns true as the subject IP address is within the object network.
Returns true as the subject IP address is the last in the object network range.
